Trial_Design.evidence: A randomized controlled trial comparing anterior pelvic external fixation (APEF) versus anterior pelvic internal fixation (APIF) for unstable pelvic ring injuries was begun in October 2010.

Participants.evidence: Patients with unstable pelvic ring injuries were enrolled and followed with respect to fracture reduction, surgical pain, complications, and functional outcome scores.

Intervention.evidence: A randomized controlled trial comparing anterior pelvic external fixation (APEF) versus anterior pelvic internal fixation (APIF) for unstable pelvic ring injuries was begun in October 2010.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Patients with unstable pelvic ring injuries were enrolled and followed with respect to fracture reduction, surgical pain, complications, and functional outcome scores.

Number_Randomised.evidence: As of January 2012, 23 patients met inclusion; however, 12 patients refused participation because of the possibility of external fixation, leaving 11 patients (four male, seven female) enrolled.

Result_Outcome.evidence: At 6-month followup, there was a single pin tract infection in the APEF cohort and no complications or pain in the APIF cohort.

Harms.evidence: At 6-month followup, there was a single pin tract infection in the APEF cohort and no complications or pain in the APIF cohort.
